duties_responsibilities.duty: Prepare flight programmes to meet Company requirements, including the scheduling of training flights in all aspects.
Update and rearrange accommodation and ground transportation for crews, as required, following any program changes.
Ensure the provision of any information required before a flight including, in particular, current weather reports and up-to-date NOTAMs, and notifying aircrew of any potential hazard to safety.
Prepare pre-flight documentation, crew briefs, airfield.
Assist with flight feasibility and aircraft performances.
Coordinate all signals relating to flight delay/re-routes to third party service providers such as ground handlers, fuel suppliers, caterers, and airport authorities.
Maintain a Watch Log recording all incidents, actions, communication, etc. relevant to the flight programme and prepare a written, accurate Handover/Status Report for the oncoming shift.
Liaise with Engineering on all matters concerning the continued serviceability of the Company's fleet with specific regard to maintaining contract commitments and schedules.

education_certification.credential: Trained in flight planning and dispatch, preferably with a certificate/dispatch license
